alert.note: Alert for Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 30 at 3:46PM CDT until May 30 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Webster County in central Iowa... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Significant ponding in Fort Dodge. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Dodge, Fort Dodge Regional Airport, Moorland and Lizard Creek State Recreation Area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
